conbody.p: There are two scheduled delivery types.

section.p: In this type, the time provided in the request is used as the absolute time. It does not depend on the SMSC.

For example, “170801191010022+” is interpreted as 08-Aug-2017 19:10:10 hrs in the Indian Standard Timezone (UTC+0530) and “170801191010028-” is interpreted as 08-Aug-2017 19:10:10 hrs in the Pacific Standard Timezone (UTC-0700).

If R is specified as the last parameter (for p) in the incoming request, then it works as the time relative to the current time of the SMSC. For example, “020610233429000R” is interpreted as a relative period of 2 years, 6 months, 10 days, 23 hours, 34 minutes and 29 seconds after the current SMSC server time.
